conclusion: Determine pressure in tube B using height of air column and atmospheric pressure.

U-shaped tube with sections A and B, section A open to atmosphere, section B closed with piston, filled with mercury, height of air column in B is 12 cm, height difference between liquid levels in A and B is 4 cm.
Calculate pressure in tube B: p_B = p_0 + rho g h_2 = 77.15 cmHg.
Pressure in tube A equals pressure in tube B when liquid levels are equal: p_A = 77.15 cmHg.
Use ideal gas law to find temperature T_A in tube A: T_A/T_{A0} = p_A/p_{A0}.
Initial pressure p_{A0} = 76 cmHg and initial temperature T_{A0} = 27°C = 300 K.
Convert temperature from Kelvin to Celsius: T_A = 304.8 K - 273.15 = 31.65°C.
